```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
nums = c(sample(4:9,3))
ama = sample(c("2(x+1)+3","3+2(x+1)","3+2(1+x)","2(1+x)+3"),1)
ams = sample(c("2(x+1)-3","2(1+x)-3"),1)
ada = sample(c("\\frac{x+1}{2}+3","3+\\frac{x+1}{2}","3+\\frac{1+x}{2}","\\frac{1+x}{2}+3"),1)
ads = sample(c("\\frac{x+1}{2}-3","\\frac{1+x}{2}-3"),1)

sds = "\\frac{x-1}{2}-3"

mad = sample(c("\\frac{1x+2}{3}","\\frac{2+1x}{3}"),1)

msm = "3(1x-2)"
msd = "\\frac{1x-2}{3}"

dsd = "\\frac{\\frac{x}{1}-2}{3}"
qs = c(ama,ams,ada,ads,sma,sms,sda,sds,mam,mad,dam,dad,msm,msd,dsm,dsd)
wd = c("adds 1, multiplies by 2, and then adds 3",
       "adds 1, multiplies by 2, and then subtracts 3",
       "adds 1, divides by 2, and then adds 3",
       "adds 1, divides by 2, and then subtracts 3",

       "divides by 1, subtracts 2, and then multiplies by 3",
       "divides by 1, subtracts 2, and then divides by 3")
n1 = paste0(nums[1])
n2 = paste0(nums[2])
n3 = paste0(nums[3])
correct_strings = list(c("Add",n1,"Multiply by",n2,"Add",n3),
                       c("Add",n1,"Multiply by",n2,"Subtract",n3),
                       c("Add",n1,"Divide by",n2,"Add",n3),
                       c("Add",n1,"Divide by",n2,"Subtract",n3),
                       c("Subtract",n1,"Multiply by",n2,"Add",n3),
                       c("Subtract",n1,"Multiply by",n2,"Subtract",n3),
                       c("Subtract",n1,"Divide by",n2,"Add",n3),
                       c("Subtract",n1,"Divide by",n2,"Subtract",n3),
                       c("Multiply by",n1,"Add",n2,"Multiply by",n3),
                       c("Multiply by",n1,"Add",n2,"Divide by",n3),
                       c("Divide by",n1,"Add",n2,"Multiply by",n3),
                       c("Divide by",n1,"Add",n2,"Divide by",n3),
                       c("Multiply by",n1,"Subtract",n2,"Multiply by",n3),
                       c("Multiply by",n1,"Subtract",n2,"Divide by",n3),
                       c("Divide by",n1,"Subtract",n2,"Multiply by",n3),
                       c("Divide by",n1,"Subtract",n2,"Divide by",n3))

w = sample(1:length(qs),1)
ex1 = gsub("1",n1,qs[w],fixed=T)
ex1 = gsub("2",n2,ex1,fixed=T)
ex1 = gsub("3",n3,ex1,fixed=T)

ac1 = c("Add","Subtract","Multiply by","Divide by")
ac2 = sort(c(n1,n2,n3))

cs = correct_strings[[w]]

sol1 = paste0(1*(ac1==cs[1]),collapse="")
sol2 = paste0(1*(ac2==n1),collapse="")
sol3 = paste0(1*(ac1==cs[3]),collapse="")
sol4 = paste0(1*(ac2==n2),collapse="")
sol5 = paste0(1*(ac1==cs[5]),collapse="")
sol6 = paste0(1*(ac2==n3),collapse="")

al1 = paste0("* ",ac1,collapse="\n")
al2 = paste0("* ",ac2,collapse="\n")

ops1 = wd[w]
ops1 = gsub("1",n1,ops1,fixed=T)
ops1 = gsub("2",n2,ops1,fixed=T)
ops1 = gsub("3",n3,ops1,fixed=T)
```

Question
========

Let function $f$ be defined with the algebraic formula below:
$$f(x) = `r ex1`$$

To calculate the output, this function applies three elementary operations to the input. Describe those three operations (in order).

1. ##ANSWER1## ##ANSWER2##
2. ##ANSWER3## ##ANSWER4##
2. ##ANSWER5## ##ANSWER6##


Answerlist
--------

`r al1`
`r al2`
`r al1`
`r al2`
`r al1`
`r al2`


Solution
========

The function `r ops1`. This is based on [PEMDAS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_operations).
